data.question: What are porous coordination polymers often referred to as?
What is the calculated charge of TCNQ molecules in TTF–TCNQ material?
What is the conductivity value (s) of TTF–TCNQ crystals?
Which metal ions are known to produce binary phases with TCNQ radical anions?
What is the crystal system and space group for compounds 1 and 2?
What is the estimated charge (z) of uncoordinated (U) TCNQ molecules in compounds 1 and 2?
What is the role of 4,4’-bipyridine in the synthesis of compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: It acts as a co-ligand incorporated into the paramagnetic metal coordination polymer backbone.

data.question: Why do compounds 1 and 2 exhibit high conductivity?
data.answer: Due to the regularly spaced partially reduced TCNQ radicals.

data.question: What indicates the delocalization of charge over the TCNQ columns in compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: The z value close to -2/3 for U in 1 and 2.

data.question: Why is the estimation of z for coordinated (C) TCNQ less reliable?
data.answer: Because of the asymmetric molecular shape of C, although C still maintains its planarity.

data.question: What does the negative Weiss temperature (q) in compound 1 indicate?
What is the significance of the conductivity values of 1 and 2 at 300 K?
data.answer: They are the highest values ever reported for coordination compounds of TCNQ.

data.question: True or False: The magnetism of TTF–TCNQ material is derived from the conduction p electrons of TTF–TCNQ.
True or False: The MII(TCNQ)2 magnets possess localized radicals.
True or False: The conductivity of compounds 1 and 2 decreases with cooling from 330 K to 300 K.
True or False: The TCNQ molecules in compounds 1 and 2 are equally charged.
True or False: The magnetism of the Mn derivative 1 is due solely to contributions from weakly coupled S = 5/2 MnII ions.
True or False: The Zn compound is diamagnetic.
True or False: The Mn–N distance in the present MnII compound is longer compared to the compound [Mn(5-TMAMsaltmen)TCNQ](ClO4)2.
